sub_title: Lead Service designer | Strategic UX designer (PDEng, MSc.)
summary:
As Service / UX Designer with 13 years experience, I advise and work within multi-disciplinary teams to plan, visualise and test new / improved services for B2B and B2C, relying on design research techniques, cognitive psychology and Design thinking. I go the extra mile for that memorable experience.

Based on strategy workshops, I analyse the business-, and user challenge and validate the problem with solid user- and data research. Based on insights I create personas, customer journeys, (service) blue prints, user flows, wireframes and prototypes and validate the solution with users. I design for multiple touch points, from mobile and desktop interfaces to personal interactions for customers, employees and/or expert users, all in close collaboration with the business and developers. 

Facilitator & trainer
As a passionate facilitator of workshops and co-creation sessions, I handle projects at every stage of the lifecycle from the initial assessment and research phase to the final delivery. I develop and give training in the design approach in- and outside the Netherlands.

Collaboration
I work collaboratively across disciplines on a daily basis, i.e. users/customers, business stakeholders, copywriters, architects, developers, visual- and interaction designers to improve the design quality and user experience. I collaborate with product owners, product area leads and tribe leads to drive design strategy and the product development roadmap.

Methodology
I am familiar with SCRUM methodology, Double Diamond, Design thinking, Google Design Sprints and Lean UX. I always advocate a solid Design process so companies will evolve and increase Design maturity. I also mentor designers and help shape their skills and design perspective.

Solid background
During the Master in Applied Cognitive Psychology (MSc.) I learned about human's cognition, perception, needs, and emotions. I obtained my Professional Doctorate in Engineering (PDEng) in the User System Interaction Post-master at TU/e. This program allowed me to combine hands-on experience with UX and service design, prototyping and user testing.

education.degree_name: Post Doctorate in Engineering (PDEng - 3rd cycle of higher education)
education.grade: Presentation: A; Process: A; Report: B (publication)

awards.title: Winner CX champion of the year
awards.description: ING has a CX champions league where colleagues can nominate a CX champion: - someone who is customer obsessed, puts customer first every day, goes an extra mile for that memorable experience and inspires others to do the same. I have become nr 1 CX champion by being nominated by 53 colleagues who wrote down why I should be called a champion.

awards.title: Team nomination for the ING Empowerment Award
awards.description: The Empowerment Awards are back this year to acknowledge, celebrate, and share empowering initiatives from across the world. My team was nominated with Mortgage of the future in the category ADVERTISEMENT. After three judging rounds, the jury chose the final 20 nominations based on how well the participants delivered on ING’s purpose – empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and business.

awards.title: Photo publication in magazine
awards.description:
I was interviewed by the editor of the editorial division of the National Geographic Magazine about my photograph of the rabbit. The photo is printed in the May edition of the international magazine with a circulation of more than 5 million copies wordlwide.
http://www.evakraaijenbrink.nl/publications/nationalgeographic/

awards.title: Photo nomination in contest
awards.description:
I was nominated in the category Nature for National Geographic Photo Content in the Netherlands. I was one out of ten nominated photo’s in this category. 29th of October the Award ceremony was in Amsterdam and the winners were announced. A professional jury consisting of editors of National Geographic evaluated the entries.
http://www.evakraaijenbrink.nl/publications/national-geographic-photo-contest/

projects.title: ING - international corporate bank
projects.description:
Commissioned by Informaat, I work for a Dutch multinational banking and financial services corporation headquartered in Amsterdam. My primary focus were retail banking and commercial banking for customers. More than 53,000 employees offer retail and commercial banking services to customers in over 40 countries.
I worked in an agile work environment, including the ability to embrace iterative product development while maintaining a cohesive and holistic view of the overall design experience.
Focus on conversion, Customer insight, Persuasion psychology, User interface design, Concept design Usabilty testing

projects.title: Amigo project - The intelligent home network
projects.description:
This user test of the Amigo Extended Home Environment Prototype was conducted by the 2007 – 2009 class of the User System Interaction (USI) Design School. USI occasionally provides Philips with support on usability-related issues.
Three separate information-gathering interviews were conducted with Philips stakeholders to obtain feedback and recommendations regarding the main expectations of the user test. Based on the results of these interviews, objectives for the user test were defined.

projects.title: Eyefreight - Transportation management
projects.description:
Commisioned by Informaat, I worked  for Eyefreight. Eyefreight provides a single platform for central coordination and detailed data visibility over complex, global-wide transportation operations. From inventory allocation and distribution planning to freight invoice settlement, Eyefreight reduces costs, improves timeliness, increases service levels, and ensures sustainability. I designed the web based application for optimal logistics performance for companies like ZALANDO, Mango, FloraHolland, Tata steel and Levi Strauss@co. 
I was an advocate for user-centered research and for a ‘design thinking’ approach to creative problem solving.
- Stakeholder interviews; Competitor analysis; Analytic review; Personas; User requirements; Business- and product requirements.
- Defined user interaction models and user experience for new and existing modules;
- Sketched and presented UX concepts and behaviors with paper sketches, wireframes, task/workflows, simple working prototypes etc.
- Communicated UX design solutions to multiple development teams through prototypes; Detailed specifications and similar types of communication documents.

projects.title: Aegon - Turkey
projects.description:
Aegon wants a multi-channel Insurance Sales Platform. As an organic extension of this vision, AEGON intends to extend the same concept with online sales, in line with her “muli-channel distribution web” strategy. Meanwhile AEGON also aims to establish a common process, product oﬀering, pricing and quotation platform for multi-channel distribution, in order to eliminate duplicate functionality and improve time-to-market.

My main tasks were:
- Analysing business and user requirements through sessions with product owners and users
- Business- and process requirement analysis with CEO and the business architect/analyst. 
- Analyzed the NEEDS (the why behind the requirements) through workshops.
- High level process overview; Scenarios; Sitemaps; Sketches and wireframes; Visual design; Validation

projects.title: Beinformed - Give training in UX process (international)
projects.description:
I facilitated workshop about the UX process beyond national boundaries. We trained and facilitated workshops with the product owners, architects and business users. With my experience in interaction design and psychology I can trigger the members in analysing the business process in more detail and visualise the customer journeys, user scenarios and dialogue flows so it becomes more clear and discussable. 
Countries visited to present methodology: Istanbul (Turkey), Willemstad (Curacao), Louisville (USA)

projects.title: Louisville government - USA
projects.description:
Lousville, a city in Kentucky, is engaged with Be Informed to develop a Proof of Concept to better understand how the Be Informed Semantis Platform could help support Louisville’s initiative to reduce the number of abandoned properties in the city. The goal was to help agencies improve service delivery by allowing them to focus on their core missions and manage their workload efficiently. 
My role: Business/ ux analyst, User experience / Interaction designer, Visual designer

projects.title: European Patent Office Munchen
projects.description:
The European Patent Office (EPO) embarked on an important change program to modernise its IT-infrastructure in a way that not only benefited EPO through a more streamlined grant process, but also allowed companies, researchers and inventors to realise important efficiency gains. EPO is set to become one of the most advanced, fully digital patent offices in the world, enabling applicants and inventors to register their patents in the most efficient and cost effective way.

I worked on:
  Patent searching
  Filing the application with the Office
  Publication
  Substantive examination
  Endless possibilities in custom backend

I worked with:
- UX designer
- Product owners
- Software engineers
- Solution architects

projects.title: Philips Health care
projects.description:
The number-one cause of death and hospitalisation in high income countries are accidents happening to young children. Philips Research is doing its part with projects that focus on child safety, aiming for innovation of safety equipment to prevent the most frequently-occurring child injuries in the home and bring peace-of-mind to parents.

Two current safety equipment concepts that unobtrusively monitor child behaviour were validated and evaluated by parents and specialists in the area of child development. Finally, I made a design suggestion for the most positive evaluated concept.

projects.title: Philips Lightning
projects.description: For the ambi-light television of Philips I investigated the visibility of hue, saturation, and luminance deviations in LEDs. My results showed that for saturation and luminance gratings there was a significant effect of spatial frequency on the visibility threshold. Both experiments show that observers are more sensitive to hue than to saturation deviations.

profile_positions.description:
Informaat is a design and consulting company for digital products and services. 

Worked 12 months for Eyefreight (transport management)
Worked 32 months for ING bank

Informaat is a design and consultancy agency for digital products and services. We support organizations in the development and implementation of their digital strategy. We work for organizations that want to take their customer experience to the next level.

Informaat was founded almost three decades ago. Today, the playing field is much different, however our mission remains the same: To enrich people’s lives by making the digital products and services they use more attractive, inspiring and user-friendly.

In doing so, we go further than the design of a single website or a nice image. It is our belief that the combination of creative design and a systematic approach leads to sustainable results, in which outside-in thinking really takes place. User-centricity is more than a “project” for us
profile_positions.title: Senior User Experience Designer

profile_positions.description:
Be Informed is an internationally operating, independent software vendor. The Be Informed business process platform transforms administrative processes. 
Customers I visited who needed complex business applications are: Aegon (International insurance and financial services organisation in Turkey), EPO (European Patent Office in Germany), Ministry of Defence, ABN Amro (financial bank), Bearingpoint (Curacao), CAK (Central Administration Office).

Thanks to Be Informed’s unique semantic technology and solutions, business applications become completely model-driven, allowing organisations to instantly execute on new strategies and regulations. Organisations using Be Informed report cost savings, much higher straight-through processing rate leading to vastly improved productivity, and a reduction in time-to-change from months to days.

My main tasks were analysing business and user requirements through sessions with product owners and users, designing high level proces overview, business scenario's, low and high fidelity prototypes for interaction design, developing the front-end of Be Informed-implementations, SCRUM meetings with development teams, agile processes, conducting user tests and making visual design for processes and marketing goals.

I also facilitate national and internationally different workshops together with a business analyst, CEO and (business) users to detect the desired business process. The main job was achieving a good experience in complex web-based applications for business users and customers. Within the 4,5 years at Beinformed I became responsible for the project approach in which UX played an important role. I have given workshops, together with the principal architect, in Turkey and Curacao in order to teach about the importance of UX in the project approach. I also traveled to Schotland, Germany and USA to consult about the best User Experience.
profile_positions.title: Interaction designer

profile_positions.description:
The USI (User System Interaction) programme develops me into a professional designer so I can realize user-friendly user-system interactions. I am trained in scientific methods and techniques for the design and evaluation of user interfaces of products, services, and systems. 

The emphasis of the program is on technologically complex systems with high concentrations of information. I am trained in user-centered design methodologies. I am focussed on preventing user problems and equipped with knowledge to come up with solutions that support users at work or at home with their information, communication and entertainment activities. 

During my internship at Philips research , I engaged in a variety of activities aimed at understanding and enhancing human cognition in the context of a Philips' research project with intelligent board games. This included conducting literature reviews, designing and implementing cognitive experiments, analyzing data using statistical methods, and contributing to the development of innovative solutions based on cognitive psychology principles. Additionally, I collaborated with multidisciplinary teams, participated in research discussions, and presented findings and recommendations to stakeholders within the organization.

I published an article and presented it at the Interact conference in Sweden.
profile_positions.title: Interaction designer

profile_positions.description: Analyze questionnaires in SPSS, prepare and create presentations with the results for the companies like Rabobank and Achmea
profile_positions.title: Data analyst - job during university

profile_positions.description: Set-up and perform experiment with 20 participants, literature study, reporting the results, presentation, title: ‘Visibility of hue, saturation and luminance deviations between LEDs for different spatial frequencies’.
profile_positions.title: Researcher – internship

profile_positions.description: Generate stimuli by photographing children’s faces, programming experiment in Matlab, monthly presentations, set-up, perform and report experiment. Master thesis: 'The influence of emotional factors on lateral masking'
profile_positions.title: Researcher – Internship

volunteer_experiences.description:
I participate voluntarily in designing a new app that helps people who suffer from a brain tumor/brain injury to effectively manage their complicated treatments. Together with 3 board members (2 committee members and engineering lead)  I designed the complete mobile app for the patients and dashboard for oncologist and nurses.
I delivered artefacts in Strategy, Research, Analysis, Design and Validation phases. This summer we hope to launch the first MVP (Minimum Viable Product) developed  by Microsoft.
